page.title: 01LAND (FROYLE/HOLYBOURNE)
page.content: The two villages of this area, Upper Froyle and Holybourne, north of the A31, both have old churches, with additions and restorations, a mixture of old and new housing and school buildings for handicapped children at the Treloar Colleges. This farmland area, ideal for barley cultivation on its chalk and clay soil, is discontinuing{hop cultivation}because of European restrictions on varieties. An area both ancient and modern, the site of Roman Vindomis adjoins modern underground food and oil terminals. Roman roads, railway and dual carriageway cross the area,{strings of {pylons and underground gas pipes carry {power supplies}and four tall masts aid modern radio-communications.
